greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of positive integers less than n with more distinct prime factors than n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
example: Column n lists the a(n) positive integers less than n with more distinct prime factors than n:
maple: b:= proc(n) option remember; nops(numtheory[factorset](n)) end:
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(omegan=omega(n)); sum(k=1, n-1, omega(k) > omegan); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 29 2018

(PARI) first(n) = {my(t = 1, pp = 1, res = vector(n)); forprime(p = 2, oo, pp*=p; if(pp > n, v = vector(t); break); t++); for(i = 1, n, o = omega(i); res[i] = v[o+1]; for(j = 1, o, v[j]++)); res} \\ _David A. Corneth_, Dec 29 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 28 2018
